summary: An email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York to Andrew Stemmer at Deutsche Bank, attaching a grand jury subpoena directed to Deutsche Bank entities and indicating a willingness to receive responses on a rolling basis. This document shows the U.S. Attorney's Office actively investigating financial aspects of the Epstein case in July 2019.

persons.name: Andrew Stemmer
persons.context: Recipient of an email from a federal prosecutor attaching a grand jury subpoena directed to Deutsche Bank entities.

connections.description: Prosecutor communicating with a Deutsche Bank representative regarding service of a grand jury subpoena and coordination of responses.

events.title: Service of Grand Jury Subpoena to Deutsche Bank
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emails Andrew Stemmer at Deutsche Bank to formally serve a grand jury subpoena directed to Deutsche Bank entities, indicating an ongoing financial investigation.

keyFacts: A federal grand jury subpoena was served on Deutsche Bank entities on July 11, 2019, as part of the Epstein investigation.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively investigating financial aspects related to Jeffrey Epstein in mid-2019.
The prosecution indicated a willingness to accept responses to the subpoena on a rolling basis, suggesting a cooperative or ongoing investigative process.
